medium_description_en: Predicts chance of successful vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC) delivery.
instructions_en: Our calculator reflects the published regression analysis and AUC calculations from the original literature, which are available here. Due to slight differences in rounding precision, you may notice minimal variations in results provided by this calculator versus others that are available.

seo.meta_description_en: Vaginal Birth After Cesarean (VBAC) predicts the chance of successful vaginal birth after cesarean delivery.
seo.keywords_en: Vaginal Birth After Cesarean (VBAC), vbac, vaginal birth, c section, c-section, cesarean, cesarean section, cesarean delivery, vbac prediction, pregnancy, pregnant, birth

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use Vaginal Birth After Cesarean (VBAC) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use Vaginal Birth After Cesarean (VBAC) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.more_info_en:
The predicted probability of successful VBAC is calculated based on the following inputs:

  • Age, years.

  • Pre-pregnancy weight, kg.

  • Height, cm.

  • Arrest disorder for previous cesarean delivery (yes or no).

  • Previous vaginal delivery only before previous cesarean delivery (yes or no).

  • Previous VBAC (yes or no).

  • Treated chronic hypertension (yes or no).

% probability successful VBAC = [ew/(1 + ew)]*100

where w = -5.952 – 0.023*(Age) – 0.024*(Pre-pregnancy weight, kg) + 0.056*(Height, cm) – 0.597*(Arrest disorder) + 0.868*(Previous vaginal delivery only before previous cesarean delivery) + 1.869*(Previous VBAC) – 0.966*(Treated chronic hypertension)

Validation.text: Costantine MM, Fox K, Byers BD, et al. Validation of the prediction model for success of vaginal birth after cesarean delivery. Obstet Gynecol. 2009;114(5):1029-1033.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Grobman WA, Sandoval G, Rice MM, et al. Prediction of vaginal birth after cesarean delivery in term gestations: a calculator without race and ethnicity. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2021;225(6):664.e1-664.e7.

Other References.text: Grobman WA, Lai Y, Landon MB, et al. Development of a nomogram for prediction of vaginal birth after cesarean delivery. Obstet Gynecol. 2007;109(4):806-812.

creator_info.about_en: William A. Grobman, MD, is a professor of obstetrics and gynecology at The Ohio State College of Medicine and the vice chair of clinical operations for the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology. He is an elected member of the National Academy of Medicine and previously served on the faculty of Northwestern University’s Feinberg School of Medicine. Dr. Grobman’s primary research is focused on predicting and preventing adverse obstetric outcomes.

options.label: Previous vaginal delivery only before previous cesarean delivery
